title: How to Do the Ditman Glitch in Resident Evil 4 (Wii Version Only)

steps.headline: After you've bought the Striker weapon and returned to the normal play window, press the - button to load the inventory screen & then select the Striker weapon.
Immediately press the - button and then immediately when you see the main play window load, press the - button again to load the inventory screen again.
Select any other weapon and then exit the inventory window.
Test Leon's running speed.
steps.description: Leon should be able to run much much faster--if not, then repeat steps 1-4 until you get the timing right.

steps.headline: Some cut-screens & other video events can cause Leon to return to normal speed.
steps.description: If that happens, then perform steps 1-4 above & Leon will again run faster.

steps.headline: Some people have reported that using the Striker weapon after initiating the Ditman Glitch would cause Leon to return to normal speed.
steps.description: I have found that claim to be untrue with my Wii system. You can switch to any weapon (including using the Striker weapon) after the Ditman Glitch has been activated without causing Leon to return to normal speed.

text: After you've bought the Striker weapon and returned to the normal play window, press the - button to load the inventory screen & then select the Striker weapon.  Press & hold the B button.  Immediately press the - button and then immediately when you see the main play window load, press the - button again to load the inventory screen again.  Select any other weapon and then exit the inventory window.  Test Leon's running speed. Leon should be able to run much much faster--if not, then repeat steps 1-4 until you get the timing right. Notes:  Some cut-screens & other video events can cause Leon to return to normal speed. If that happens, then perform steps 1-4 above & Leon will again run faster. Some people have reported that using the Striker weapon after initiating the Ditman Glitch would cause Leon to return to normal speed. I have found that claim to be untrue with my Wii system. You can switch to any weapon (including using the Striker weapon) after the Ditman Glitch has been activated without causing Leon to return to normal speed.
